item.title: Workshop with Ellandar Productions
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
I’ve been working on a new musical (it’s a secret!!!) with Ellandar productions. A development day of pure pleasure as we improvised musical numbers, played with text and character, worked with themes and scene ideas. Just a fun filled day of exploration – one of the joys of working in the arts. Iskandar was leading us all as director, and ...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been working on a new musical (it’s a secret!!!) with Ellandar productions. A development day of pure pleasure as we improvised musical numbers, played with text and character, worked with themes and scene ideas. Just a fun filled day of exploration – one of the joys of working in the arts.

Iskandar was leading us all as director, and the piece is going to have some more development later in the year. I’m really excited to be a part of this project and I can’t wait to see where it will go.

item.title: Nights dream
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
I have been filming on my first night shoot for Night’s Dream with Velocity Films. Playing the marvellously vindictive Puck in an original reinterpretation of A Midsummer Night’s Dream. You can see a picture above. Obviously it’s raining, hence the particularly attractive bright pink umbrella. You have not been a proper actor until you have had to squelch through mud, ...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I have been filming on my first night shoot for Night’s Dream with Velocity Films. Playing the marvellously vindictive Puck in an original reinterpretation of A Midsummer Night’s Dream. You can see a picture above. Obviously it’s raining, hence the particularly attractive bright pink umbrella.

You have not been a proper actor until you have had to squelch through mud, stand in a rainstorm, or crouch in the freezing dark waiting to maim, stab or perform some sort of dangerous mock killing move on camera. Ain’t nothing like a serial killer to get your actor creativity flowing! 

In this, Puck is a dangerous and flamboyant bad guy, with an ambitious yearning to be the top dog. And apparently, as discussed by the crew, bad guys are my thing.

I’m not sure what that says about me…

Never judge an actor by his parts.

item.title: Fringe Time
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
Took a project to the fringe this week. I was playing Jack, a world war 1 soldier in a musical about women spies. The audience seemed really positive about the work and we got great comments about the story, and the music, even if our reviews weren’t as kind. Having given the show this road test in front of an ...
Read More
item.content:encoded: Took a project to the fringe this week. I was playing Jack, a world war 1 soldier in a musical about women spies. The audience seemed really positive about the work and we got great comments about the story, and the music, even if our reviews weren’t as kind. Having given the show this road test in front of an audience made up primarily of people we don’t know, we’re able to make changes and refine it, and bring it back better than ever. Plus it was a load of fun to do.

item.title: We Will Not Shortly Have A Rasher On The Coals For Money
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
I am in the final few days of rehearsal at Bard In The Botanics for The Merchant of Venice in which I am playing Launcelot Gobbo and Salerio! I’m having a great time working on my first professional production and having my first experience of outdoor theatre. Filling the space is a challenge, it’s massive after all. Not a little theatre ...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I am in the final few days of rehearsal at Bard In The Botanics for The Merchant of Venice in which I am playing Launcelot Gobbo and Salerio! I’m having a great time working on my first professional production and having my first experience of outdoor theatre. Filling the space is a challenge, it’s massive after all. Not a little theatre but a park, and making sure everyone can hear is a top priority. Then there’s Shakespeare and his language to get to grips with, and for your mouth around. After all, he’s the King of incredibly wordy sentences. But it’s an exciting challenge and I’m loving working on it with all my fellow actors. It opens on Thursday, and is directed by Gordon Barr, the Artistic Director of the Bard in The Botanics. 
For more information, see: bardinthebotanics.co.uk
